Where: SEE is the Standard Estimated Error. If SEE is small, it suggests an enhanced equation. SEE is expressed below;
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$ \mathrm{SEE}=\sqrt{\frac{{\left({Y}_{exp}-{Y}_{pred}\right)}^2}{N-P-1}} $$\end{document}
